predicate.note: Frames file for 'square' based on sentences in financial subcorpus. No Verbnet entry.

example.name: deplorable grammar
example.text: They said contributing to the downward drift was the fact that many professional traders had chosen *trace* to square positions ahead of the weekend.

roleset.name: mathematics
roleset.note: I actually doubt the result argument would ever occur. That sounds really odd to me.

roleset.name: compete

example.name: active
example.text: Not only are Japan's financial institutions putting their enormous clot to work; increasingly they're squaring off against one another in unprecedented public fashion.

roleset.note: Here causal agent and first competitor are merged.

example.name: (pseudo?)passive
example.text: The restyled 300ZX costs as much as $33,000 and is squared off against the Porsche 944, which begins at $41,900.
